Method Detail

getPearsonCorrelation

public static double getPearsonCorrelation(double[] x,
                                           double[] y)
Returns the Pearson correlation coefficient of the 2 sets of values. 
    x = sample values in molecule 0
    y = sample values in molecule 1
    n = number of samples in each molecule
    Sx = standard deviation of x
    Sy = standard deviation of y
 
                                               _              _
                     sum( i=0 to n-1, ( x[i] - x ) * ( y[i] - y ))
 correlationValue = -----------------------------------------------
                                ( n - 1 ) Sx * Sy
 
 References:
 Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia (2010, April 13).
     Correlation and Dependence.
     Retrieved April 14, 2010, from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Correlation#Pearson.27s_product-moment_coefficient

Parameters:
x - The first set of values to use for the calculation.
y - The second set of values to use for the calculation.
Returns:
The Pearson correlation value.

getSpearmanCorrelation

public static double getSpearmanCorrelation(double[] x,
                                            double[] y)
Returns the Spearman rank correlation coefficient of the 2 sets of data. 
 x = sample values in molecule 0
 y = sample values in molecule 1
 n = number of samples in each molecule
 Rx = rank array of x, ie. the new locations of each element of x if x were sorted
 Ry = rank array of y, ie. the new locations of each element of y if y were sorted
 
                         6 * sum( i=0 to n-1, ( Rx[i] - Ry[i] )^2 )
 correlationValue = 1 - --------------------------------------------
                                       n * ( n^2 - 1 )
 
 References: 
 Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia (2010, April 1). 
     Spearman's rank correlation coefficient. 
     Retrieved April 14, 2010, from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spearman's_rank_correlation_coefficient
 Spiegel, Murray R. (1961). Statistics, 2nd Edition (pp 376,391-393). New York.

Parameters:
x - The first set of data to use for the calculation.
y - The second set of data to use for the calculation.
Returns:
The Spearman correlation value.

getKendallCorrelation

public static double getKendallCorrelation(double[] x,
                                           double[] y)
Returns the Kendall tau rank correlation coefficient of the 2 sets of data. 
 x = sample values of molecule 0
 y = sample values of molecule 1
 n = number of samples in each molecule
 Rx = the rank of the samples in molecule 0
 Ry = the rank of the samples in molecule 1
 Tx = the number of ties in x.
 Ty = the number of ties in y.
 concordant = The number of concordant pairs
 discordant = The number of discordant pairs

                                 concordant - discordant
 correlationValue = ---------------------------------------------
                              n*(n-1)            n*(n-1)         
                     sqrt( ( ------- - Tx ) * (  ------- - Ty ) )
                                2                   2            

 Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia (2010, March 25). 
     Kendall tau rank correlation coefficient. 
     Retrieved April 14, 2010, from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kendall_tau_rank_correlation_coefficient

Parameters:
x - The first set of data to use for the calculation.
y - The second set of data to use for the calculation.
Returns:
The Kendall tau correlation value.

linearFit

public static Polynomial linearFit(double[] values)
Reduces a set of values to a linear regression, using the array indices as the x values. Finds an equation of the form y = ax + b which best matches the passed in data. References: Fry, John M. (2010). Regression: Linear Models in Statistics (pp 3-6) Springer.

Parameters:
values - The y values of the points on a graph.
Returns:
A Polynomial object which can be used to find the regression line.

Finds the power law curve fit for a set of data. Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting--Power Law." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. Retrieved Dec 13, 2010, http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFittingPowerLaw.html

Parameters:
values - The series of values to determine the curve for.
Returns:
The determined equation for the curve through these points.
